title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A gripping tale of racial injustice and childhood innocence in the American South.

author: George Orwell
description: A chilling vision of a totalitarian future where Big Brother watches everything.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A witty and romantic tale of love overcoming social prejudices.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A tragic story of love, wealth, and the American Dream in the Jazz Age.

title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
description: A young wizard discovers his magical heritage and begins his journey at Hogwarts.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A teenager's cynical journey through New York City after being expelled from prep school.

title: Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: An epic quest begins as a hobbit must destroy a powerful ring to save Middle-earth.

title: The Hunger Games
author: Suzanne Collins
description: A girl volunteers to take her sister's place in a deadly televised competition.

title: Dune
author: Frank Herbert
description: A complex tale of politics, religion, and ecology on a desert planet.

title: The Handmaid's Tale
author: Margaret Atwood
description: A haunting vision of a future where women's rights have been stripped away.

title: Gone Girl
author: Gillian Flynn
description: A psychological thriller about a marriage gone terribly wrong.

title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
author: Stieg Larsson
description: A journalist and a hacker investigate a decades-old disappearance.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A society where happiness is manufactured and individuality is suppressed.

title: The Fault in Our Stars
author: John Green
description: Two teenagers with cancer fall in love and face life's challenges together.

title: The Da Vinci Code
author: Dan Brown
description: A symbologist uncovers a religious conspiracy hidden in famous artworks.

title: Where the Crawdads Sing
author: Delia Owens
description: A coming-of-age story about a girl who grows up isolated in the marshes.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: A shepherd boy's journey to find treasure leads to self-discovery.

title: Educated
author: Tara Westover
description: A memoir about education, family, and the struggle between loyalty and independence.

title: The Silent Patient
author: Alex Michaelides
description: A psychotherapist becomes obsessed with treating a woman who refuses to speak.

title: Circe
author: Madeline Miller
description: The story of the Greek goddess Circe and her journey from outcast to powerful witch.
